definition: lit. ashes burn once more (idiom); fig. sb lost returns to have influence/sth malevolent returns to haunt one
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
ash/dust/lime/gray/discouraged/dejected
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to repeat/to double/to overlap/complex (not simple)/compound/composite/double/diplo-/duplicate/overlapping/to duplicate
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)

sentences.english: Glue- sniffing among Singapore's youth is making a worrying comeback after many years in decline.
sentences.chinese: 沉寂多年的青少年嗅吸强力胶现象死灰复燃。

sentences.english: What does this resurgence of tribalism mean to the foreign policy community?
sentences.chinese: 这种部落主义的死灰复燃对外交政策界意味着什么？

sentences.english: All of this has led to a resurgence of religiosity.
sentences.chinese: 所有这一切都导致了宗教信仰的死灰复燃。

sentences.english: Because period of treatment is too short, bring about pathogenic bacteria resurgence and cause recrudesce.
sentences.chinese: 由于疗程过短，导致致病菌死灰复燃而引起复发。

sentences.english: Superstitious activities have come to life again recently.
sentences.chinese: 近来，封建迷信活动又死灰复燃了。

sentences.english: old allegations of forced overtime burbled back to life.
sentences.chinese: 强迫加班的古老恶俗又死灰复燃。

definition: lit. to return in a swirl of dust (idiom)/fig. to regroup and come back even stronger/to make a comeback
to check/to contain/to hold back/to keep within limits/to constrain/to restrain
to purge
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
to bring under control/to regulate/to restore to good condition/(coll.) to fix (a person)/to prepare (a meal etc)
to hold back/to check (i.e. to stop sb's advance)/to resist/esp. with negative, irresistible, unstoppable etc
to crack down on/to take severe measures against
to root out/to eradicate/to sweep away/to abolish
internal disorder/civil strife/civil unrest
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
first signs/development (of a situation)
solve one problem only to find another cropping up
pinyin: an4 xia4 hu2 lu2 fu2 qi3 piao2

definition: to strike a severe blow/to crack down/to take strong measures
